channel.title: 1st time Unix user, I can't install AXO Gui, Help Please!
channel.description:
As I have mentioned in another post, I have installed Mint Linux, I am a first timer at this after many years under windows, It all installed fine on my prehistoric laptop which I want to dedicate to the Axo. :dizzy_face: However now with my tail between my legs I have no idea how to install Axo Gui. As per the below instructions, I spent all night searching for associations that we help me recognize what I need to do. The only thing I think I can figure out is the instructions refer to Terminal controls.
As this is a seriously noob position to be in, I apologize to anyone that this post may offend. :sob: For anyone who can assist, I will greatly appreciate it. !!! :astonished:
2.install axoloti runtime ◦unpack axo_runtime.*.tgz into user home directory e.g. cd ~ ; tar zxvf axoloti_runtime.tgz ◦you will now have a folder ~/axoloti_runtime/platform_linux
3.install application ◦install debian package, using sudo dpkg -i axoloti_1.0.deb ◦this will install into /opt ◦Axoloti app will be on your application menu (may be different on different distros)
4.install dependent packages ◦using : sudo apt-get install -y lib32z1 lib32ncurses5 lib32bz2-1.0
5.grant permissions for your user to use the USB device ◦make sure the axoloti board is not connected ◦run ~/axoloti_runtime/platform_linux/add_udev_rules.sh

item.title: 1st time Unix user, I can't install AXO Gui, Help Please!
item.dc:creator: @mongrol
item.description:
@mongrol wrote:

Ah. I didn't notice the 32bit in your post. Yes, x86 (32bit) isn't quite straightforward on linux but it's not really difficult. Come back when you're ready and we'll have another go.

Read full topic
item.source: 1st time Unix user, I can't install AXO Gui, Help Please!

item.title: 1st time Unix user, I can't install AXO Gui, Help Please!
item.dc:creator: @Gavin Gavin
item.description:
@Gavin wrote:

Thanks @mongrel,
I was working on it last night with no success, then later through other posts found comments regarding the GUI not easily installing on 32 bit systems. I did see where someone had listed the process for installing on 32bit, but for now, that is a bit beyond my Unix related skills, so will leave for a later challenge. Thanks again.

Read full topic
item.source: 1st time Unix user, I can't install AXO Gui, Help Please!

item.title: 1st time Unix user, I can't install AXO Gui, Help Please!
item.dc:creator: @mongrol
item.description:
@mongrol wrote:

The terminal commands are typed into a "Terminal". Look in Accessories menu or I think Mint has a terminal app on the panel (little black square icon). This is just like cmd on Windows.

The GUI is the "axoloti_1.0.deb" file. This is like a WIndows Installer. Open up terminal and do just as it says.

sudo dpkg -i axoloti_1.0.deb

and it'll appear in your Application Menu somewhere

Read full topic
item.source: 1st time Unix user, I can't install AXO Gui, Help Please!

item.title: 1st time Unix user, I can't install AXO Gui, Help Please!
item.dc:creator: @Gavin Gavin
item.description:
@Gavin wrote:

As I have mentioned in another post, I have installed Mint Linux, I am a first timer at this after many years under windows, It all installed fine on my prehistoric laptop which I want to dedicate to the Axo.
However now with my tail between my legs I have no idea how to install Axo Gui.
As per the below instructions, I spent all night searching for associations that we help me recognize what I need to do. The only thing I think I can figure out is the instructions refer to Terminal controls.

As this is a seriously noob position to be in, I apologize to anyone that this post may offend.
For anyone who can assist, I will greatly appreciate it. !!!

2.install axoloti runtime
◦unpack axo_runtime.*.tgz into user home directory e.g. cd ~ ; tar zxvf axoloti_runtime.tgz
◦you will now have a folder ~/axoloti_runtime/platform_linux

3.install application
◦install debian package, using sudo dpkg -i axoloti_1.0.deb
◦this will install into /opt
◦Axoloti app will be on your application menu (may be different on different distros)

4.install dependent packages
◦using : sudo apt-get install -y lib32z1 lib32ncurses5 lib32bz2-1.0

5.grant permissions for your user to use the USB device
◦make sure the axoloti board is not connected
◦run ~/axoloti_runtime/platform_linux/add_udev_rules.sh
